definitions.text: (linguistics) a grammatical rule (or other linguistic feature) that is found in all languages
(logic) a proposition that asserts something of all members of a class
a behavioral convention or pattern characteristic of all members of a particular culture or of all human beings
examples: some form of religion seems to be a human universal

definitions.text: coupling that connects two rotating shafts allowing freedom of movement in all directions
examples: in motor vehicles a universal joint allows the driveshaft to move up and down as the vehicle passes over bumps

definitions.text: of worldwide scope or applicability; ; - Christopher Morley
examples: the shrewdest political and ecumenical comment of our time

definitions.text: applicable to or common to all members of a group or set
examples: the play opened to universal acclaim
rap enjoys universal appeal among teenage boys

definitions.text: adapted to various purposes, sizes, forms, operations; ,
